etymologies: late 19th century: from modern Latin Nymphalidae, from Latin nympha ‘nymph’

definitions: an insect of a large family of strikingly marked butterflies that have small forelegs not used for walking, including many familiar butterflies of temperate regions, such as the monarch and viceroy.

notes.text: Family Nymphalidae (sometimes restricted to those that are now usually placed in the subfamily Nymphalinae)

shortDefinitions: insect of large family of strikingly marked butterflies which have small forelegs that are not used for walking
